meanings.definition: A person who is in bondage; a slave.
meanings.sent1: The ancient king had many thralls who worked in his palace.
meanings.sent2: The thralls were forced to toil in the fields under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The thralls in the story were actually kind-hearted and helped each other escape.
meanings.sent4: The thralls of fear held him back from pursuing his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The image of the thralls in chains haunted his dreams.

meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer sought to thralls the entire village with his dark magic.
meanings.sent2: The conquerors aimed to thralls the defeated nation and make them obey their commands.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy decided to thralls the grumpy old troll for a day.
meanings.sent4: The addiction seemed to thralls him, controlling his every move.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic melody thralls all who hear it, making them dance uncontrollably.
